Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Intraperitoneal Hyperthermic Chemoperfusion with Oxaliplatin for Peritoneal Surface Malignancy

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised into cohorts of three

Participants.evidence: included adults with peritoneal dissemination from colorectal or appendiceal cancers

Intervention.evidence: undergoing cytoreductive surgery followed by a 2-hour IPHC with escalating oxaliplatin doses

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to determine the dose-limiting toxicity (DLT) and maximum tolerated dose (MTD) of oxaliplatin in IPHC

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was DLT, defined as grade 3 toxicity lasting 5 days

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not applicable

Number_Randomised.evidence: Fifteen patients were enrolled across two dose levels

Result_Outcome.evidence: DLTs at 250 mg/m² were observed in two of three patients, establishing the MTD at 200 mg/m²

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were significant at 250 mg/m²
